entry.question: Dinobot Enigma says "5 Dinobots in bot mode", can I use Wave 1 Dinobots to form Volcanicus?
entry.answer: No. The Wave 2 Combiner Dinobots must be used. This was covered in a video.

entry.question: If a character has more than one Cargo Trailer, how much additional attack does it have?
entry.answer:
One cargo trailer → +1 attack
Two cargo trailers → +4 attack
Three cargo trailers → +9 attack Each cargo trailer checks for how many cargo trailers are on the bot. So, with three cargo trailers equipped, the first one checks, sees that three cargo trailers are on the bot, and adds three attack. Then the second one checks and adds an additional three attack and so on.

entry.question: How does Sideboarding work in Limited competitions (e.g. Sealed or Draft)?
entry.answer: The Tournament Rules (2019-11-21) say that "Players participating in Limited tournaments may freely change the composition of their decks between matches (but not games) by exchanging cards from their deck for other cards in their card pool without being required to return their deck to its original composition before their next match.". This is the expectation for regular instore play, however, for the Energon International it was determined that (in this Facebook post) that "Players will need to return to their registered configuration prior to Game 1 of any match and they will be able to sideboard cards in during Games 2 & 3." Despite this expectation, most competitions appear to follow the Energon International format, but ultimtely it is up to the discretion of the tournament organizer.

entry.question: What do you do with battle cards costing 1 or more stars?
entry.answer: You include them in your Turbo deck as usual. They do not apply to the cost of your deck in Turbo, so they do not affect the amount of damage taken before the game.

entry.question: With respect to Perceptor's alt mode ability, is zero a pile?
entry.answer: Yes, zero is a pile. It is perfectly fine to split the cards into two piles, one of four cards and one of zero. Listen to this designer interview for confirmation (30:26 into the interview).
